turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Americas Quarterly.
turn.1: What was the Americas Quarterly Social Inclusion Index?
turn.2: The Index tracked social inclusion within and across countries over the long-term, addressing the multiple dimensions of social inclusion, and drawing on existing statistical data sources including the Latin American Public Opinion Project (LAPOP) at Vanderbilt University; World Bank’s Global Financial Inclusion Index; UNDP Human Development Report; and World Bank’s Socio-Economic Database for Latin America and the Caribbean (SEDLAC).
turn.4: Each variable in the Index was scored by country, and countries are then ranked by overall score and by individual indicator.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: The Index served to help broaden the debate—and scholarship—on this crucial issue, providing a platform for debate and discussion about social inclusion in the region.
turn.8: The inaugural Social Inclusion Index was released in the Spring 2012 issue of "Americas Quarterly"'ranking 15 variables across 12 countries.
turn.10: The United States was not included in the relative ranking in this edition.
turn.11: What were some of the countries ranked?
turn.12: The 2012 rankings were:   In 2013, the Index added four new Central American countries (Costa Rica, El Salvador, Honduras, and Panama) and new indicators for financial inclusion, LGBT rights and women ’s rights.
